item.title: Display Nonsense: Multiple monitors w/ lightdm and xrandr
item.description: Handling monitor configuration in a barebones Linux install has always been kind of a pain in my experience, and this was further amplified with the additional requirement of dynamically configuring monitors for my laptop. So, here’s the crux of the problem: I want to map a bunch of monitor port/software states to one of two physical states. This can be expressed algorithmically: if I don’t have any external monitors plugged into my laptop, use the internal screen, otherwise arrange the monitors from right to left in descending size.

item.title: Advent of Code: 2020 Retrospect
item.description: edit 2021-05-15: Yeah, I’m probably not going to finish writing this. Too many things came up; most of the cool things I did are long forgotten; I’ve (kind of?) moved on to new interests. Advent of Code is an annual programming event that spans – you guessed it – the month of December. Challenges are released at midnight for the first 25 days, and programmers race to develop working solutions to solve each problem.
